urls.title: Roma and Travellers in six countries
urls.description: This report presents findings from FRA‚Äôs 2019 survey on Roma and Travellers in Belgium, France, Ireland, the Netherlands, Sweden and the United Kingdom. The survey included interviews with almost 4,700 Roma and Travellers, collecting information on more than 8,200 individuals living in their households. These reports constitute background material for a comparative report for the project ‚ÄúRoma and Travellers Survey 2019‚Äù. The country research was prepared by FRA‚Äôs research network FRANET. urls.title: Protecting migrants in an irregular situation from labour
urls.description: The Employers Sanctions Directive was primarily enacted to dissuade employers from recruiting migrants in an irregular situation, but it also contains provisions to protect workers. It facilitates access to justice for exploited workers and sets out workers‚Äô rights to claim back payment of outstanding wages. The directive also contains provisions to enhance the effectiveness of labour inspections. This report describes how the 25 Member States bound by the directive have been implementing its protective

text:

urls.title: Fundamental Rights Report 2021
urls.description: FRA‚Äôs Fundamental Rights Report 2021 reviews major developments in the field in 2020, identifying both achievements and areas of concern. It also presents FRA‚Äôs opinions on these developments, including a synopsis of the evidence supporting these opinions. This year‚Äôs focus chapter explores the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on fundamental rights. The remaining chapters cover: the EU Charter of Fundamental Rights; equality and non-discrimination; racism, xenophobia and related intolerance; Roma equality

urls.title: EU Framework for the UN Convention on the Rights of Persons with
urls.description: The United Nations Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities (CRPD) is the first binding international human rights instrument to specifically address disability. Its aim is to "promote, protect and ensure the full and equal enjoyment of all human rights and fundamental freedoms by all persons with disabilities, and to promote respect for their inherent dignity ". The Convention is a powerful tool to help people with disabilities, local communities and governments explore ways of fulfilling
